intro: Galium capsiriense, commonly known as the Cape iris, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Galium capsiriense is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
